scenario:
Verizon Communications (VZ) is an overlooked AI stock with a 52-week low share price. The company contributes to the growth of the AI sector through its 5G wireless network, supporting fast speeds and security required for AI edge computing. Verizon's partnership with Nvidia delivers AI to private networks, and its 5G Ultra Wideband network is expanding, opening up new opportunities for growth and innovation.

The AI edge computing sector is forecast to expand tenfold from $27 billion in 2024 to $270 billion by 2032. Verizon's wireless services revenue grew 3% year-over-year in Q3, but overall revenue was flat. The company's large debt burden, over $150 billion, is a concern, but it benefits from strong free cash flow (FCF) of $14.5 billion year-to-date.

Verizon's dividend yield is 7%, and it has raised its dividend for the 18th straight year. The company's forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio is eight, lower than its main rivals AT&T and T-Mobile US. This suggests Verizon's stock is a better value. With a robust dividend, strong FCF, and a growing wireless service business, Verizon stock is a buy for long-term investment.
